paragraphs: A direct air connection will be established between the capitals of the Czech Republic and North Macedonia. Starting from December 15, 2025, the Prague - Skopje route will be operated by the Hungarian low-cost airline WizzAir. This was announced by the press service of Prague's Václav Havel Airport on Thursday.
The carrier's plane will fly between the cities three times a week - in winter on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, and in summer on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays.
The route will be serviced by an Airbus A321neo aircraft.
Tickets are already on sale. The cost of a one-way flight at a promotional fare starts from 660 kroner.
